name: repopularize
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to make someone or something popular again: The song was re-popularised in the 1944 movie, "Meet Me in St. Louis", starring Judy Garland. As a chef and restaurateur, he was renowned for using the best local vegetables and for re-popularizing the endive.
More examplesFewer examplesMarceau repopularized the ancient art of pantomime for the modern age.Ragtime classic "The Entertainer" was repopularised in 1973 by its inclusion in the movie The Sting.Acoustic swing began resurfacing in the late 1970s, when young acoustic artists began to repopularize it.
